subject: Programming
title: John Carmack and Game Engine Innovation
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on John Carmack and Game Engine Innovation.

hook.text: John Carmack made first-person 3D gaming possible on hardware that wasn't supposed to handle it.

buildup.text: He wrote the engines for Doom and Quake, inventing techniques that defined real-time 3D graphics.

discovery.text: Carmack open sourced his game engines, letting other developers learn and build on his breakthroughs.

twist.text: His trick was pushing hardware to its absolute limit through clever math, not brute force.

climax.text: Modern VR, simulations, and game engines all trace techniques back to Carmack's early innovations.

punchline.text: He made the impossible render in real time.

quiz.question: What groundbreaking games did John Carmack create engines for?
